runs.comm: pitched up full outside off, Lumb plants the front foot and drills the ball straight to the man set slightly back at cover
slightly shorter, punched on the up in front of square, again picks out the fielder
kicking off a length, at the body and Lumb wears it on the thigh pad trying to play across the line
short, outside off and pulled, doesn't time it and the ball rolls slowly wide of mid-on
decent bumper from Johnson, gets it up above Hales' eyeline, he crouches out of the way
speared across, back of a length and there's an energetic appeal as the ball darts past the outside edge - umpire not interested
slightly back of a length and wide of the stumps, Lumb carves the ball through point with a whip-crack slash
bit of width again, Lumb opens the shoulders and uppercuts over gully, down to third man
on leg stump, short of a length ball deflects away off the pad
sits back and muscles a pull through midwicket, plenty of wood on that but still Warner should have cut it off on the boundary, somehow he slid over it, to the general delight of the crowd
clips this one off the pads, behind square and this time Warner fields without mishap
touch short, on the stumps, pulled to the man at midwicket
fullish-length ball, squirted into the covers from the crease
on the pads, Hales whips across the line and forces the ball to the boundary in front of deep square leg - Hales is off the mark
drops short and this time he just uses the pace to pull round the corner, sends the ball skidding behind square this time
better line and length, not quite short enough to pull, played from in front of leg stump back down the track
angled across on a length, Hales drives on the back foot, gets an inside edge towards midwicket
pitched up and driven hard coming forwards, mid-off collects and throws but Hales was home
good length, outside off, punched into the covers on the front foot
big appeal from Wade as Coulter-Nile beats the outside edge of Hales' bat ... but even the bowler didn't fancy that one
on the stumps, worked into the leg side for one

Lumb hoicks a length ball on the pads h-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-i-g-h into the leg side, Glenn Maxwell does tremendously to get anywhere near it out at deep midwicket but misjudges the descent and dives past it as it bounces and then trickles over the rope
length outside off, pushed square on the off side
goes round the wicket, angled in and holding its line, nips past the outside edge
inside-edged past the stumps! Hales gets away with one, a Chinese cut that was a whisker from hitting the stumps, wrong-footed Wade and scuttled for four
another boundary, Hales swatting across the line and getting far more edge than middle on it, the ball races to fine leg
good length, pushed across and steered with an open face to backward point
well, he's genuinely got hold of that one ... clears the front foot, hits through the line and deposits Faulkner (not literally) high over long-on for the first six of the match
closes the face and crunches in front of square, nothing more than a glance really, but it beats the fielder in the deep, despite a good, full-length effort
on the pads, gets a thin edge and they pick up one to midwicket, despite a moment's hesitation
dug in short, swings hard across the line and top-edged over the keeper for four. Hard to stop those!
fuller length and punched into the off side
short and outside off, stays back and gets on top of a drive towards point, who is set back and they get one
this is dismissive stuff, walking down the wicket and clubbing a length ball over mid-on, just clears the man and skids away
another malevolent swipe across the line from Lumb, such a strong batsmen and he flicks a length ball forcefully off his pads in front of deep midwicket for consecutive boundaries
slightly short outside off, drops back and steers a couple through point
punched down the ground, towards long-on but he has to come in and they get two
outside off, goes back and opens the face for a single behind point
mind the windows! Me oh my, that's gone a long way, right in the slot and brutalised over long-on by Lumb. He's had his Weetabix this morning
full again but wider this time and carved over cover to the sweeper
gets the full-bunger in, dug out behind square on the off side
skips forward, opens the shoulders and drills through the covers, beats the man on the ring for a couple more
tossed up and pushed into the off side
floated up wide of off stump, lovely stroke from Hales, opening the face to guide the ball through backward point to the boundary
length ball, straightening on leg stump, tucked through square
looped up on leg stump, Lumb sweeps across the line and it hits the boot, bounces high into the leg side where Wade catches it - there's an appeal but no bat or glove adjudged to be involved
legbreak, skidding towards leg stump, pitched outside though and they pick up one as the ball rolls past Wade
skidding on towards leg stump, plays across the line, another leg bye
clipped off the pads through the leg side
advances and swats a length ball down the ground back past the bowler

very nearly a mix up, and a direct hit from Faulkner would have seen Hales run out by a mile - he had got an inside edge on a pull, maybe taken a blow on the box and stood and watched it as it dropped to the pitch, Lumb had come charging down and Hales had to set off at the last minute as the bowler followed through
pitched up and driven back, Faulkner gets a hand on it
slightly overpitched on leg stump and a swingeing leg glance hammers the ball flat to the boundary
advances down the track and hacks one to long--off
tossed up on leg stump, Hales waits on it and clips a couple through midwicket - that's fifty for Hales, who has had his struggles this season but just drinks in this format
tossed up outside off, leans out and pushes one through the covers
over the wicket to the left-hander, very wide of the stumps, maybe the googly, Lumb gets his foot to the pitch and sweeps behind square
whips a length ball off his pads to leg
gives this plenty of air, drifting across the lefty, throws the bat and gets an inside edge, Wade does well to stop it with a boot
full toss, advances and thumps over Ahmed's head for one to long-off
heaved over the leg side, he came down the pitch outside leg and then had to fetch it from outside off
swing and a miss at a full delivery going across outside off
he's connected with that! Six more. On a length, a cutter, allowed Hales to get underneath it with a clean swing of the bat over long-on
drags the length back even shorter and gets pulled wide of short-fine leg...Johnson neither one thing or the other those last two deliveries
full outside off, slices this in the air through backward point
creamed again...Johnson stays full, Lumb just gives himself a hint of room and drills it hard and flat over mid-off. It pitches fractionally before the rope. Fierce power from Lumb.
full at middle and leg, flicked through midwicket

first international wicket! Lumb goes for a slog sweep, the ball goes straight up in the air then floats behind the stumps on the breeze. Wade turns, trots back and settles under the catch. Ahmed is on the ledger
dragged down a touch short, Hales pulls it through straight midwicket to the right of long-on
comes forward, drives with an open face through the off side
floated up outside off, Wright pushes it square through point
cut off the stumps, another misfield, this time by backward point, although they would probably have got the single anyway
big full toss outside off, flies off the top edge to third man as Hales aims more through cover
short outside off, flat-bat pulled down to long-on
beaten outside off as he plays over the top of a full delivery
gets another boundary to fine leg, but it was a pin-point yorker from Coulter-Nile which Hales somehow managed to inside edge through his legs
crunches this one back to the bowler
this skews off the bottom of the bat as he aims something mighty over the off side, ends up dropped well short of any of the deep fielders
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to cover
down the pitch and whips it through midwicket to the right of long-on where Warner loses his footing and stumbles, much to the amusement of the crowd
another brace into the leg side, placed with good pace through midwicket so the deep man couldn't quite get in fast enough
uses his feet again and drilled down to long-off when I think he was aiming leg side
tucked off the stumps to deep square
flicked through midwicket and this time he's kept to a single...decent over for Australia
full at the stumps, driven to mid-on who is inside the circle...Wright just trying to over-hit at the moment
back of a length, beats Wright's attempt to play square through the off side
excellent over so far, Wright mistimes another pull which hits Johnson in his follow through
banged in shorter, Wright pulls firmly but straight to deep square-leg
yorker at off stump, Hales can only squeeze it down to long-off
another one beats the keeper! We've seen a few of them today. Wright gets a bottom edge as he aims an off-side drive to a full delivery and it deflects past a diving Wade to his left
speared wide outside off from round the wicket, jabbed to deep cover
he finds the middle this time...down the pitch and strikes through the line, sending it dead-eye straight down the ground
fired wide outside off again, Wright catches up with it and slices through short third-man...Wright now up and running
well, did deep midwicket misjudge this? It was a low full toss that Wright clubbed towards the boundary, but it landed inside the rope with the fielder a few yards in
driven into the off side
another juicy full toss, swung through the leg side and this time deep midwicket gets around
full at leg stump, flicked in the air through midwicket
well held! Wright tries to get a low full toss over mid-off, but Johnson times his leap to perfection and holds it two hands, ensuring he doesn't let it spill as he thuds into the ground
he's away this time, cuts this through backward point and places it wide of third man
clubbed down to long-on, lost his shape a little on the shot
uses his feet, makes it a full toss, crunched down to long-on
gets down on one knee, lap-sweeps this down to long-on
a big 'un as Morgan picks this up from outside off and launches it comfortably over deep midwicket...was on a friendly length from Coulter-Nile
driven straight to mid-off...Morgan felt he had to get the dive out
bonus for England, this is a no-ball which Hales flicks high in the air to split deep midwicket and long-on
can't really make the most of it, gets another length ball but Hales' bat twists in his hands and the shot lobs between fielders on the off side
backs to leg and carves this over backward point, wrong length again...into the 90s
gets inside the line and pulls but picks out short fine-leg
wide outside off, driven high over the covers but the sweeper is able to cut off the boundary...productive over
full outside off, driven to long-off
drifting towards leg stump, he's a little fortunate that it only costs two leg byes...deflects square of the wicket and Wade had to do the chasing
good delivery, yorker at middle stump, he can't beat midwicket
excellent again, speared in towards middle and leg, they scamper one to midwicket this time
missed out, really, on a big full toss as he clubs it straight down the ground for a couple
still no hundred for England...gets another low full toss which he clouts towards the bottom of the bat and is well taken, low at long-on
well bowled! lovely delivery from Ahmed, bravely flighted up. It grips and spins past Buttler's prod as he just tried to dab it into the off side
swept off leg stump out to deep square
all the way...Morgan connects cleanly with a slog-sweep and that was always heading into the crowd
gone this time, with a googly, Morgan hits it firmly but without the height or distance and picks out deep midwicket
confidence of youth...reverse sweep first ball but it goes straight to backward point
fired in outside leg, but Bopara has moved so far outside the stumps that when he misses it goes inside his body. Dot ball to finish
